name: 2017_04_humanities_student_major_799_adviceanimals
title: 2017-04-humanities-student-major_799_AdviceAnimals.txt
content_scrubbed:
BA in sociology aka liberal_arts (i took of lot of medical sociology/sociology of the body) second tier state school, $48k right out the gates doing medicaid audits /compliance then a program with medicaid a. nd veterans affairs. This was midwest. Won two regional excellence awards. Super rewarding: helped vets exposed to agent orange and thier families get appropriate care. 

Bestie has spanish degree aka liberal_arts and took vietnamese courses-skypes doctor visits with non english speakers from house for $32 an hour 

Good friend- russian lit (aka liberal_arts) $42,500 teaching high school in texas

Good friend- fashion and apparel design liberal_arts: 40 to 42 k $ case manager for the homeless , used to work in adult protective services 

Shitty friend - art and media aka liberal_arts- IEP coordinator , makes over 35,000$ 

Pothead friend- library masters degree $60,000 gets to drive book mobile stoned

We're pretty open and competitive with each each other, as well as a few of these jobs werecones i also applied for or was interested in, like librarian and case manager



You know why trade schools arent for everyone? Because it takes a huge physical strain on your body. My middle school science teacher was a union journeyman, made great money but destroyed his back. My dad was a welder and was terribly burned in an accident in west of tulsa oil site. My grandpa welded after the War and got a hunchback immediately besides damage to skin and nerves from sun exposure and holding positions for hours. plus a lot of those jobs are seasonal or contract, meaning you are constantly chasing the next job or located in a boomtown on the ass end of hell like a pipe line in the seirra nevadas or the one bit of canada thats ugly. 

So yea, its great if you wanted to wallow in shit , live with five guys in a camper for $1000 a month or destroy your sanity or body in two years
